frame.name: Others_situation_as_stimulus
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels an emotion as evoked as an <fen>Other</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Experiencer">One</fex> might <t>pity</t> <fex name="Other">the frail old man in East Berlin</fex>.</ex>
<ex>She appealed for <t>compassion</t> <fex name="Other">for sufferers</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Experiencer">I</fex> <t>feel</t> <fex name="Other">for women who also long to have children but can't</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Experiencer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
</def-root>

FE.name: Other
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Other</fen> is the person that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The extent to which the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> is the explanation for why the <fen>Other</fen> evokes a certain emotional response. </def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> is the condition(s) under which the <fen>Other</fen> evokes its response. </def-root>

FE.name: Parameter
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Parameter</fen> is a domain in which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the feelings of the <fen>Other</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the way in which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the feelings of the <fen>Other</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). <fen>Manner</fen> may also describe a state of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that affects the details of the emotional experience.
</def-root>

FE.name: Situation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Situation</fen> is the circumstances or topic about which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> feels an emotion.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>How often the <fen>Other</fen> gets sympathy from the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: compassion.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: understanding and having awareness of another's suffering

lexUnit.name: empathize.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: understand another's lot; feel another's emotions as one's own

lexUnit.name: pity.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: feel badly for another's misfortune
